abstract: Ben S. Bernanke said the government needed to turn its attention to restoring fiscal balance, even as it tries to spend its way out of the economic crisis.
snippet: Ben S. Bernanke said the government needed to turn its attention to restoring fiscal balance, even as it tries to spend its way out of the economic crisis.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve chairman, Ben S. Bernanke, said on Wednesday that the United States needed to develop a plan to restore fiscal balance, even as the government builds huge budget deficits as it tries to spend its way out of the worst economic crisis since the Great Depression.

headline.main: As Deficits Mount, Fed Chief Calls for a Path to Fiscal Balance
headline.print_headline: As Deficits Mount, Fed Chief Calls for a Path to Fiscal Balance
